question: Question7
question_paragraph: A B+ tree of orderdis a tree in which each internal node has betweendand2dkey values. An internal node withMkey values hasM+1children. The root (if it is an internal node) has between1and2dkey values. The distance of a node from the root is the length of the path from the root to the node. All leaves are at the same distance from the root. The height of the tree is the distance of a leaf from the root.a). What is the total number of key values in the internal nodes of a B+ tree withlleaves(l≥2)?b). What is the maximum number of internal nodes in a B+ tree of order 4 with 52 leaves?c). What is the minimum number of leaves in a B+ tree of orderdand heighth(h≥1)?

question: Question8
question_paragraph:
Consider the following query :SELECT E.eno, COUNT(*)
FROM Employees E
GROUP BY E.enoIf an index onenois available, the query can be answered by scanning only the index if
options: the index is only hash and clustered
the index is only B+tree and clustered
index can be hash or B+ tree and clustered or non-clustered
index can be hash or B+ tree and clustered
correct_answer: index can be hash or B+ tree and clustered or non-clustered

question: Question9
question_paragraph: Trigger is
options: Statement that enables to start any DBMS
Statement that is executed by the user when debugging an application program
The condition that the system tests for the validity of the database user
Statement that is executed automatically by the system as a side effect of a modification of the database
correct_answer: Statement that is executed automatically by the system as a side effect of a modification of the database

question: Question19
question_paragraph: In the indexed scheme of blocks to a file, the maximum possible size of the file depends on:
options: The number of blocks used for index and the size of index
Size of Blocks and size of Address
correct_answer: The number of blocks used for index and the size of index

question: Question23
question_paragraph: Database systems that store each relation in a separate operating system file may use the operating system’s authorization scheme, instead of defining a special scheme themselves. In this case, which of the following is false?
options: The administrator enjoys more control on the grant option
It is difficult to differentiate among the update, delete and insert authorizations.
Cannot store more than one relation in a file.
Operations on the database are speeded up as the authorization procedure is carried out at the operating system level.
correct_answer: Operations on the database are speeded up as the authorization procedure is carried out at the operating system level.

question: Question26
question_paragraph: A data file consisting of 1,50,000 student-records is stored on a hard disk with block size of 4096 bytes. The data file is sorted on the primary key RollNo. The size of a record pointer for this disk is 7 bytes. Each student-record has a candidate key attribute called ANum of size 12 bytes. Suppose an index file with records consisting of two fields, ANum value and the record pointer the corresponding student record, is built and stored on the same disk. Assume that the records of data file and index file are not split across disk blocks. The number of blocks in the index file is ________ .

question: Question27
question_paragraph: Database applications were built directly on top of file system to overcome the following drawbacks of using file-systems:(i)Data redundancy and inconsistency(ii)Difficulty in accessing Data(iii)Data isolation(iv)Integrity problems

question: Question28
question_paragraph: Which RAID level gives block level striping with double distributed parity?

question: Question29
question_paragraph: Which of the following is correct?
options: B-trees are for storing data on disk and B+ trees are for main memory.
Range queries are faster on B+ trees.
B-trees are for primary indexes and B+ trees are for secondary indexes.
The height of a B+ tree is independent of the number of records.
correct_answer: Range queries are faster on B+ trees.

question: Question30
question_paragraph: Which of the following related to snowflake schema is true?
options: Each dimension is represented by a single dimensional table
It is not an extension of star schema

question: Question31
question_paragraph: In the index allocation scheme of blocks to a file, the maximum possible size of the file depends on :
options: the size of the blocks, and the size of the ad­dress of the blocks.
the number of blocks used for the index, and the size of the blocks.
the size of the blocks, the number of blocks used for the index, and the size of the address of the blocks.
correct_answer: the number of blocks used for the index, and the size of the blocks.

question: Question32
question_paragraph: An index is clustered, if
options: it is on a set of fields that form a candidate key.
it is on a set of fields that include the primary key.
the data records of the file are organized in the same order as the data entries of the index.
the data records of the file are organized not in the same order as the data entries of the index.
correct_answer: the data records of the file are organized in the same order as the data entries of the index.
